Specimen Type: Corneal scrapings, contact lens solution, cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), tissue biopsy, or other body fluids
Purpose: To detect and isolate Acanthamoeba from clinical specimens for accurate diagnosis and patient care.
Container: Sterile leak-proof container appropriate for the collected specimen
Equipment: Modified non-nutrient agar plates seeded with E. coli, incubator (30 Â°C), phase-contrast microscope, sterile inoculation loop or pipette, slides and coverslips
